Mingqi Liu

Postdoctoral Scholar
University of Southern California
ml_013@usc.edu

Welcome!

I am a Postdoctoral Scholar at the University of Southern California. My research focuses on the evolution of plate tectonics, with particular interests in both long-term tectonic deformation and short-term earthquake simulation.

My areas of expertise include:

  • The opening and closure of mid-ocean ridges
  • Subduction zone destruction
  • Earthquake cycle simulation
  • Frictional laws and physical mechanisms
  • Grain size reduction mechanisms
  • Advanced numerical modeling techniques

I earned my PhD in Geodynamics from ETH Zurich, where I developed extensive expertise in numerical simulations.

News

  • [Jan. 2025] New paper published in Tectonics: The Effect of Brittle-Ductile Weakening on the Formation of Faulting Patterns at Mid-Ocean Ridges
  • [Dec. 2024] Happy New Year!!!
